intro: Trichosporum boschianum, commonly known as the Boschi's trichosporum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
